original: Douglas, Oscar Wilhelm, greve, major, Eksjö, f. 25/12/96 i Sthlm av dåv. utr:min., greve L. D. o. grev:an Anna Ehrensvärd. G. 26 m. Dagmar Ida Skarstedt. Barn: Jacob f. 27, Gösta-Otto 30, Anna 36, Maria 41. — Stud:ex. v. Lundsbergs sk. 16, off :-ex. 18. Sångstud. i Ital. 27-30 o. i Berhn 32-34. Fänrik o. löjtn. v. Svea livg. 19-24, v. Andra livgren :reg. 24, friv. överg:stat 28-40, kapt. v. Livgren :reg. 40-43, major v. Jönköp.-Kalmar reg. sed. 43. Halvpartsäg. i Allguvi i Östergötl. samt husäg. i Eksjö. Led. av stadsfullm. i Eksjö 47. RSO 46, RTyskÖO 37, Mil. skytteM 23, Sv. jäg:förb. förtj :m i guld 38. 15 Drake af Hagelsrum, Fredrik Carl-Erik, major, Skövde, f. 17/12/98 i Umeå av hovr:not. E. D. o. Maria Hedberg. G. 29 m. Karin Grenander. Barn: Jan f. 30, Ulla 31,_Ulf 34, Eriiik 40. — Studrex. i Strängnäs 19, offiex. 21. Löjtn. 23, kapten 36, major v. P. 4 42. RSO. .
translated: Douglas, Oscar Wilhelm, Count, Major, Eksjö, born on December 25th, 1896 in Stockholm to the deceased Minister of Foreign Affairs, Count L.D. and Countess Anna Ehrensvärd. Married on the 26th of an unspecified month and year to Dagmar Ida Skarstedt. Children: Jacob born in 1927, Gösta-Otto in 1930, Anna in 1936, and Maria in 1941. Graduated from Lundberg School in 1916, commissioned officer in 1918. Studied singing in Italy from 1927 to 1930 and in Berlin from 1932 to 1934. Commissioned officer in the Svea Life Guards from 1919 to 1924 and in the Second Life Grenadier Regiment from 1924 to 1928. Voluntarily retired from military service from 1928 to 1940. Captain in the Life Grenadier Regiment from 1940 to 1943, and then Major in the Jönköping-Kalmar Regiment. Co-owner of Allguvi in Östergötland and house owner in Eksjö. Elected member of the city council in Eksjö in 1947. Recipient of the Royal Order of the Seraphim in 1946, the Royal German Order in 1937, the Military Shooting Medal in 1923, and the Swedish Hunter's Association Gold Medal in 1938. Also listed is Fredrik Carl-Erik Drake af Hagelsrum, Major, Skövde, born on December 17th, 1898 in Umeå to the deceased Court Notary E.D. and Maria Hedberg. Married on an unspecified date in 1929 to Karin Grenander. Children: Jan born in 1930, Ulla in 1931, Ulf in 1934, and Erik in 1940. Graduated from Strängnäs in 1919, commissioned officer in 1921. Lieutenant in 1923, Captain in 1936, and Major in the P. 4 in 1942. Recipient of the Royal Order of the Seraphim, but the year is not specified.
